intro: Tulista minima var. poellnitziana, commonly known as the Poellnitz's tulista, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native ecosystem.
